intro: Blepharodon asterion, commonly known as the star-leaf begonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant belongs to the family Begoniaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its leaves are typically velvety and have a unique, intricate pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
